channel.title: Objective-C Reference on Protocol Buffers Documentation
channel.description: Recent content in Objective-C Reference on Protocol Buffers Documentation

item.title: Objective-C Generated Code Guide
item.description: Any differences between proto2, proto3, and Editions generated code are highlighted. You should read the proto2 language guide and/or proto3 language guide and/or the Editions guide before reading this document. Compiler invocation The protocol buffer compiler produces Objective-C output when invoked with the --objc_out= command-line flag. The parameter to the --objc_out= option is the directory where you want the compiler to write your Objective-C output. The compiler creates a header file and an implementation file for each .
